question: If you could choose between living in a country with four distinct seasons or one with year-round warm weather, which would you choose?
title: Language & Vocabulary
content:
• Instead of "good", try: beneficial, advantageous, favorable.
  • Instead of "enjoy", try: appreciate, relish, take pleasure in.
  • Instead of "weather", try: climate, atmospheric conditions, meteorological variations.
  • You said: "Having a good weather is nice" → You could say: "Experiencing favorable weather conditions is enjoyable."
  • You said: "I think you can really enjoy whether or state" → You could say: "I believe that appreciating various weather conditions enhances one's quality of life."
  • You said: "It's too cold for me" → You could say: "The cold temperatures can be quite challenging for me."
